蝬蝬蝬

蝬字的基本解释

蝬
zōng
〔三蝬〕古书上说的一种蛤蜊。

蝬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zōng］
［《廣韻》子紅切，平東，精。］
蛤类。参见“三蝬”。

蝬字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蝬； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1090第24
【唐韻】子紅切【集韻】祖叢切，?音葼。【玉篇】三蝬，蛤屬。【郭璞·江賦】三蝬?江。【註】《臨海水土物志》曰：三蝬，似蛤。

蝬字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
蝬字的起名意思

暂无。

Stalk
Basic explanation of words
Stalk
zōng
〔三蝬〕A clam mentioned in ancient books.
Stalk
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zōng］
["Guangyun" sub-red cut, flat east, fine. ]
Clams. See "three stalks".
Stalk
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蝬; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1090 Page 24
[Tang Yun] Zihong cut [Jiyun] Zucong cut,? Yinfeng. 【Jade articles】Three clams, clams. [Guo Pu·Jiang Fu] Three worms? Jiang. [Note] "Linhai Sea Soil and Material History" says: Three stalks, like clams.
